plot: Two powerful German guns control the seas past the Greek island of Navarone making the evacuation of endangered British troops on a neighboring island impossible. Air attack is useless so a team of six Allied and Greek soldiers is put ashore to meet up with partisans to try and dynamite the guns. The mission is perilous enough anyway but are the Germans on the island getting further help too?.

m.role: A Father to His Men: Miller snidely suggests that Mallory play this part when he's trying to convince Mallory to shoot Anna.
The Guns of Navarone. Miller snidely suggests that Mallory play this part when he's trying to convince Mallory to shoot The Mole.
Dirty Coward: Andrea pretends to be this when captured, so the Germans will let their guard down around him.
Corporal Miller in the film version of The Guns of Navarone.
Non-Action Snarker: Miller as played by David Niven.
Officer and a Gentleman: Deconstructed with Mallory. Miller even calls him out on it.
"Butcher" Brown (AKA "The Butcher of Barcelona") in The Guns of Navarone.
Subverted in The Guns of Navarone. A team member known as "The Butcher of Barcelona" is actually burnt out after years of killing and gets killed himself when he hesitates to kill an enemy.
The Butcher: "Butcher" Brown, AKA "The Butcher of Barcelona". Ironically Brown has become tired of the killing — this eventually gets him killed when he hesitates to finish off the guard on the boat.

name: The Guns of Navarone
